# NSUserNotificationAction

**Class**

An action that the user can take in response to receiving a notification.

## Declaration

```swift
class NSUserNotificationAction
```

## Overview

User notifications can specify one or more actions to show to the user by using the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSUserNotification/additionalActivationAction] or [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSUserNotification/additionalActions] properties. [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSUserNotificationAction] objects contain the localized title shown to the user and an identifier used to differentiate between presented actions.

## Creating User Notification Actions

- **init(identifier:title:)**: Creates a user notification action with a specified identifier and title.

## Getting the Identifier and Title

- **identifier**: The identifier for the user notification action.
- **title**: The localized title shown to the user.

## User Notifications

- **NSUserNotification**: A notification that can be scheduled for display in the notification center.
- **NSUserNotificationCenter**: An object that delivers notifications from apps to the user.
- **NSUserNotificationCenterDelegate**: An interface that enables customizing the behavior of the default notification center.

## Inherits From

- NSObject

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSCopying
- NSObjectProtocol
